title: PLA study suggests China Fire Dragon missiles could sink US warships
message:
The Houthis have employed a diverse array of attack methods, including ballistic missiles, drones, and anti-ship cruise missiles.
In the military war game simulation, 12 Fire Dragon 480 rockets were launched to attack two Ticonderoga-class cruisers.
After numerous rounds of simulations, scientists estimated that the survival rate of the two Ticonderoga-class cruisers under this tactic was close to zero.
However, when integrated with long-range rockets, they pose a significant threat to warships, according to Li.
Meanwhile the US is gradually decommissioning its Ticonderoga-class cruisers in favour of more modern ships, with the last one due to be retired in 2027.
event_breakdown:
Attack on Saudi oil tankers in Red Sea, Houthi drone attack on Saudi airport in Najran, Houthi missile attack on Saudi-led coalition forces in Marib
The Houthis, a rebel group based in Yemen, have carried out a number of attacks on Saudi Arabia and Saudi-led coalition forces in the region. These include the attack on Saudi oil tankers in the Red Sea, a drone attack on a Saudi airport in Najran, and a missile attack on Saudi-led coalition forces in Marib. These attacks have caused significant damage and disruption to Saudi targets.

title: Israel air defense caught off guard by Hezbollah low - tech drones
message:
With the imminent prospect of a regionwide war exploding with Hezbollah and its allies, Israel is scrambling to reformulate its air defense approach to deal with these new, lower-tech threats.
Hezbollah’s small, remote-controlled drones — believed to be simply bought over the counter — can operate independent of radio signals.
But it’s psychological — they are showing that they can penetrate the air defense, they can reach very far behind your border lines,” he said, speaking from the international arms expo in Paris.
The biggest test for Israel’s air defense, however, came after Iran retaliated for the bombing in April of its embassy in Damascus, Syria, and the killing of two senior Revolutionary Guard commanders.
Iran, together with regional allies, fired hundreds of cruise and ballistic missiles and launched hundreds of explosive drones at Israel.

title: Hezbollah strikes Israeli military factory , outposts in response to Lebanon aggression
message:
The Lebanese Hezbollah resistance forces have conducted a strike against Israeli military positions in the northern side of the 1948 occupied territories in retaliation for a deadly attack on a town in southern Lebanon.
Hezbollah said that the operation was conducted in reprisal for an Israeli drone strike that targeted a car in Lebanon’s southern town of Borgholiya, killing a man.
Earlier, missiles launched by Hezbollah had hit an Israeli military factory.
Hezbollah has been carrying out almost daily rocket attacks on Israeli positions in retaliation for the regime’s aggression against Lebanon and in solidarity with Palestinians.
Two Israeli wars waged against Lebanon in 2000 and 2006 were met with strong resistance from Hezbollah, resulting in the retreat of the regime in both conflicts.

title: Hezbollah publishes drone surveillance footage of key Israeli sites in Haifa

Hezbollah publishes drone surveillance footage of key Israeli sites in HaifaIran Press TVTuesday, 18 June 2024 4:48 PMThe Lebanese Hezbollah resistance movement has published video footage gathered from its surveillance aircraft of strategic locations in the northern part of the 1948 occupied territories, including sea and air ports in the city of Haifa.
The decision to broadcast the footage, which included images of residential and military sites in and around Haifa, including port facilities, was apparently aimed at Israeli audience.
The footage underlines the mounting difficulties that the Israeli military has encountered in dealing with the drone capabilities of Hezbollah.
There has been no reaction from Israeli political or military authorities on Hezbollah's drone footage of Haifa yet.
Earlier on Tuesday, Hezbollah fighters attacked a Merkava tank inside the Israeli army's Hadab Yarin site with a combat drone.

title: Israeli talk of war with Hezbollah almost certainly fresh attempt at deterrence
message:
The reality is that Hezbollah, an ally of Iran, is a more powerful adversary than Hamas in Gaza.
Hezbollah and Israel have been trading blows since Hamas launched its attack eight months ago, and Hezbollah has insisted it will not stop unless there is a ceasefire in Gaza.
Sarit Zehavi, the founder of Alma, an education centre that focuses on the security of Israel’s northern border, said the current position was unsustainable: “There is already a second front.
Galilee [in northern Israel] is under daily attack from UAVs, rockets and missiles.
“Both Israel and Hezbollah routinely prepare for potential escalations.

title: 1 killed , 9 injured in Israeli airstrike on Lebanese village
message:
Beirut, June 19 (UNI) One civilian was killed, and nine others were injured in an Israeli airstrike on a southern Lebanese village, Lebanese military sources told Xinhua.
They added that Israeli warplanes raided Tuesday four towns and villages in the border area in southern Lebanon, destroying and damaging several houses.
During the past few days, border villages and towns in southern Lebanon witnessed an unprecedented escalation between Hezbollah and the Israeli army.
The military sources said that the Lebanese army positions monitored the launch of dozens of surface-to-surface missiles in the afternoon and several drones from southern Lebanon to northern Israel.
Also on Tuesday, a Hezbollah source confirmed to Al-Araby Al-Jadeed TV, a pan-Arab news outlet, that Hezbollah will not retreat beyond the Litani River, which the source said is an Israeli condition to reach an agreement to end the confrontations.
event_breakdown: Civilian killed, 9 others injured in Israeli airstrike on southern Lebanese village

title: Ship  believed to have sunk  after Red Sea attack : security agency - World
message:
DUBAI: A merchant ship is thought to have sunk in the Red Sea after a deadly attack by Yemeni Houthis that forced it to be abandoned last week, a security agency said.
The MV Tutor, which was holed during an attack that left one Filipino sailor dead, is “believed to have sunk”, the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations said late Tuesday.
National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said a Sri Lankan crew member was critically wounded in a separate Houthi attack on the MV Verbena on Thursday.
Houthis claim attack on merchant ship in Red Sea off YemenThe Tutor appears to be the second ship sunk by the Houthis in recent months after the Rubymar, carrying thousands of tonnes of fertiliser, went down in the Red Sea in March after a missile strike.
The Houthis, who seized Yemen’s capital Sanaa in 2014, have been at war with a Saudi-led coalition since 2015.
location: The main focus of the event takes place in the Red Sea.

title: Second ship attacked by Yemen Houthi rebels sinks in the Red Sea
message:
A cargo ship sank in the Red Sea Wednesday after being attacked by Yemen's Houthi rebels, the U.K. military's Maritime Trade Operations center (UKMTO) said in a notice to other sailors in the region.
The ship, a Liberian-flagged bulk carrier called the Tutor, was the second to sink due to a Houthi attack.
The United States Navy assisted in evacuating the crew of the ship when it was attacked on June 12.
5th Fleet/HandoutHouthi attacks on commercial vessels have continued in the vital shipping corridors of the Red Sea and surrounding waters since November.
The U.S. accused Iran in December of being "deeply involved" in the attacks on Red Sea shipping.

event_breakdown:
A new U.S. spy agency has been formed that operates in space and will focus its efforts on detecting and tracking missile launches around the globe, including those that could be fired by North Korea, according to several news reports.

According to the Washington Free Beacon, the National Reconnaissance Office's (NRO) new unit, the Geosynchronous Space Situational Awareness Program, has a spacecraft that can detect and track missile launches anywhere in the world. This includes North Korean threats, the Free Beacon reported.

Danny Lotan, a scientist with NRO, told the publication that the spacecraft can detect and track missile launches from North Korea, such as its recent tests of intercontinental ballistic missiles. He also said that the craft has a "high probability of success" of detecting North Korean missile launches in its first few months.

According to the BBC, the new agency will also be able to track missile launches from China and Russia.

The new unit is a result of the merger of two other NRO agencies, the Space-Based Space Surveillance and the Geosynchronous Intelligence System.

title: Ship  believed to have sunk  after Yemeni rebels attack in Red Sea – The Frontier Post
message:
DUBAI (AFP): A merchant ship is thought to have sunk in the Red Sea after a deadly attack by Yemeni rebels that forced it to be abandoned last week, a security agency said.
The MV Tutor, which was holed during an attack that left one Filipino sailor dead, is “believed to have sunk”, the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations said late Tuesday.
It was evacuated in a military operation on Friday and left drifting, its engine room breached and taking on water.
The Iran-backed Huthi rebels have launched scores of drone and missile attacks on the vital sea route since November, describing them as retaliation for the Israel-Hamas war.
The Tutor appears to be the second ship sunk by the Huthis in recent months after the Rubymar, carrying thousands of tonnes of fertiliser, went down in the Red Sea in March after a missile strike.
location: The main focus of the event is in the Red Sea.

title: What a War Between Israel and Lebanon Hezbollah Might Look Like
message:
The Lebanese militant group Hezbollah launched its most significant rocket assault yet at Israel last week in retaliation for an Israeli airstrike that killed a senior Hezbollah commander, fueling concern that the conflict could rapidly spiral out.
On Tuesday, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said that while he believed that neither Israel nor Hezbollah sought a wider war, there was nonetheless “momentum potentially in that direction.” His Israeli counterpart, Foreign Minister Israel Katz, noted on Tuesday that his country was close to reaching a decision on whether to go to war, and cautioned that “in a total war, Hezbollah will be destroyed and Lebanon will be hit hard.”But Israel would also be bloodied.
Israel and Hezbollah fought a 34-day war in 2006 that ended in a tense stalemate.
A Hezbollah commander told Voice of America in 2016 that the conflict was a “dress rehearsal” for the next war with Israel.
Like Hamas in Gaza, Hezbollah is deeply embedded in Lebanon’s civilian population.

message:

COTABATO CITY — Residents have urged for a deep probe into the bombing of a fuel station in Lamitan City, Basilan on Tuesday night.
“I condemn that atrocity in strongest terms,” Salliman, whom barangay leaders in Lamitan City patronize politically, told reporters in Cotabato City and other areas in the Bangsamoro region via text message after the incident.
A passerby was slightly hurt in the bombing of the roadside fuel station in Barangay Matibay, according to officials of the Lamitan City Police Station and the Army’s 101st Infantry Brigade.
Police Lt. Col. Arlan Delumpines, Lamitan City police chief, told reporters on Wednesday morning that extortion was the most likely motive for the bombing and was not perpetrated by Abu Sayyaf terrorists.

title: Club Q Shooter Sentenced For Federal Hate Crime And Gun Charges
message:
Anderson Lee Aldrich, the individual responsible for the 2022 mass shooting at Club Q, an LGBTQ2S+ nightclub in Colorado Springs, was sentenced to life in prison without parole plus 190 years on Tuesday (June 18).
Aldrich, 24, pleaded guilty to 74 federal hate crime and gun charges related to the attack that left five dead and 19 injured.
The sentencing follows Aldrich's guilty plea to state charges last year, which resulted in five consecutive life terms and an additional 2,212 years without parole.
The shooting occurred as patrons were gathering for Transgender Day of Remembrance events, including a drag show.
The shooting has been described as a "brazen and calculated" attack on the club's employees and patrons and a "bias-motivated, premeditated, mass-casualty attack."

Pride Parade Shooting in Orlando
The man responsible for a mass shooting at a gay nightclub in Orlando, Florida, in 2016 has been sentenced to life in prison without parole.

U.S. District Judge Paul G. Byron imposed the sentence on Monday on 29-year-old Omar Mateen, who opened fire at the Pulse nightclub on June 12, 2016, killing 49 people. Mateen pleaded guilty in 2016 to 49 counts of first-degree murder and 53 counts of attempted murder.

Prosecutors had asked for a death sentence, but a jury rejected that option.

Mateen's lawyers had asked for a shorter sentence, arguing that he deserved leniency because he was mentally ill.

title: KPCC chief courts controversy for objectionable remarks about CM
message:
Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee president K. Sudhakaran on Wednesday courted controversy by asking how many people Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan had killed by hurling bombs.
The veteran leader made the remark about Mr. Vijayan when reporters sought his reaction to the recent death of Velayudhan, 86, in the district in a bomb explosion.
According to the police, Velayudhan died when he picked up a bomb he found in an uninhabited property near Thalassery, Kannur, where he had gone to collect coconuts on Tuesday.
When reporters mentioned Mr. Vijayan’s statement about the alleged display of crude bombs in the Kannur District Congress Committee (DCC) office in the past, Mr. Sudhakaran called the Chief Minister “stupid” and asked how many people had Vijayan killed by hurling bombs and shooting.

title: UN says Israel use of heavy bombs in Gaza is potential war crime ; Israel rejects allegations
message:
UN says Israel’s use of heavy bombs in Gaza is potential war crime; Israel rejects allegationsThe United Nations human rights office said Wednesday Israel may have committed war crimes through the use of heavy bombs on at least six occasions, a charge that Israeli officials quickly denied.
The report from the United Nations Human Rights Office of the High Commissioner details six incidents of Israel deploying munitions, including heavy 2,000-pound bombs, along with 1,000-pound bombs and 250-pound bombs in densely populated areas of Gaza.
Israel’s use of heavy bombs in Gaza has been a major source of friction between the U.S. and Israeli officials.
President Biden is holding back heavy bombs over concerns about their use in densely populated areas.
Two of the strikes on densely populated areas identified in the U.N. report were in northern Gaza at the Jabalya market and at the Jabalya refugee camp in October.

message:
Israel and Lebanese militia Hezbollah are inching toward a wider war, even as the U.S. works frantically to stop the conflict in Gaza spreading to Israel’s northern border.
Israel and Hezbollah have exchanged tit-for-tat fire since Oct. 7 when the Iran-aligned militia backed attacks by Palestinian movement Hamas that sparked a war in Gaza.
While both Hezbollah and Israel have been reluctant to turn hostilities into a bigger conflict, the two sides are increasingly signaling an intent to expand their fight.
Throughout Tuesday, Israeli warplanes launched strikes against squads from Hezbollah’s air force unit that were sending drones destined for Israel, the Israeli military said.
Hezbollah says that its attacks are in support of the Palestinians and that it won’t stop until Israel ceases its war in Gaza.

title: New Age | Israeli use of heavy bombs raise  serious concern under laws of war : UN
message:
| AFP photoIsrael’s repeated use of heavy bombs in the densely-populated Gaza Strip indicates repeated violations of the laws of war, the UN said Wednesday, highlighting six attacks that killed at least 218 people.
They involved the suspected use of up to 2,000-pound bombs on residential buildings, a school, refugee camps and a market.
GBU-31s, along with 1,000-pound GBU-32s and 250-pound GBU-39s ‘are mostly used to penetrate through several floors of concrete and can completely collapse tall structures,’ UN rights office spokesman Jeremy Laurence told reporters.
The missiles fired by Hamas, while ‘absolutely unacceptable’, he said, ‘have not caused significant killing during the war’ by comparison.
Israel harshly criticised the report, suggesting it aimed to ‘lambast and single-out Israel, while further shielding Hamas terrorists in Gaza’.

message:

title: Israeli drone strike kills military officer in Syria
message:
Damascus, June 19 : The Israeli military killed a Syrian officer in a drone strike in southern Syria on Wednesday morning, the Syrian Ministry of Defence said.
The attack targeted two Syrian military sites in the Quneitra and Daraa provinces in southern Syria at around 7 a.m. (local time), killing one Syrian officer and causing damage to an unknown amount of materials, Xinhua news agency reported citing the ministry.
The Syrian government condemned the strike, labelling it as an "act of aggression" by Israel.
Tensions between Israel and Syria have escalated in recent years, with numerous airstrikes attributed to Israel, targeting what Israel perceives as Iranian assets and Hezbollah positions and weaponry in Syria.
Israel has repeatedly said that its actions are aimed at preventing Iranian entrenchment near its borders.
event_breakdown: The Israeli attack also targeted Iranian-backed militias and Hezbollah, a Lebanese paramilitary group backed by Iran. The Israeli government has vowed to stop Iran from establishing a permanent military presence in Syria, which Israel sees as a threat to its security.

title: The leader of Lebanon militant Hezbollah group warns archenemy Israel against wider war
message:

title: Metro : Bystanders fatally stab man who was sexually assaulting woman
message:
Metro: Bystanders fatally stab man who was sexually assaulting womanA man who Las Vegas police say was attempting to sexually assault a woman was killed Tuesday in a stabbing by people who overhead the assault and rushed to the woman’s rescue, according to Metro Police.
The incident occurred just past 3:30 p.m., when police received reports of a stabbing in the 3400 block of East Charleston Boulevard.
Metro officers found the man in an alley and transported him to University Medical Center, where he was later pronounced dead, police said.
Police later located a separate crime scene in a shed at the 1000 block of Laurel Avenue, where detectives determined the man allegedly had committed sexual assault against a woman inside.
Metro did not identify any suspects but did say the investigation was still ongoing.

Metro Police report that a man who was allegedly attempting to sexually assault a woman was stabbed to death by bystanders on Tuesday, March 29, 2022. The incident took place at about 3:30 p.m. near the intersection of East Charleston Boulevard and Maryland Parkway in Las Vegas, Nevada.

Police say they received calls about an assault in progress and found the man injured when they arrived. He was transported to University Medical Center but was later pronounced dead.

In a separate location, officers found a separate crime scene in a shed on the 1000 block of Laurel Avenue, where detectives believe the alleged sexual assault took place. Police have not released the identity of the suspect but say the investigation is ongoing.

Separately, the head of a U.N. inquiry accused the Israeli military of carrying out an "extermination" of Palestinians.
In a report on six deadly Israeli attacks, the U.N. human rights office (OHCHR) said Israeli forces "may have systematically violated the principles of distinction, proportionality, and precautions in attack".
In a separate meeting of the U.N. Human Rights Council in Geneva, the head of a U.N. Commission of Inquiry, Navi Pillay, said perpetrators of abuses in the conflict must be brought to account.
The U.N. rights office report details six incidents that took place between Oct. 7 and Dec. 2, in which it was able to assess the kinds of weapons, the means and the methods used in these attacks.

title: UN says Israel violates use of precision bombs in Gaza war
message:
Israel has not been paying sufficient attention to the protection of civilians when using precision-guided bombs during the Gaza war, the UN Human Rights Office said on Wednesday.
It assumes that bombs of the types GBU-31, GBU-32 and GBU-39 were used, which can penetrate concrete and destroy several floors of a building.
They were used to attack residential buildings, a school, a refugee camp and a market, the office said.
In an attack presumably with nine GBU-31 bombs on 2 December, the destruction affected an area with a diameter of 130 metres, the UN agency said.
PREMIUM TIMES delivers fact-based journalism for Nigerians, by Nigerians — and our community of supporters, the readers who donate, make our work possible.
event_breakdown:
Israel's military bombed a refugee camp, a school, a market, and several residential buildings in Gaza in December, the UN Human Rights Office said on Wednesday.

The military used precision-guided bombs in these attacks. These bombs, the GBU-31, GBU-32, and GBU-39, can blow up multiple floors of a building and penetrate concrete. The UN agency has demanded that the Israeli army stop using these bombs to target private citizens in Gaza.

However, the Israeli military defended the attacks, saying they were carried out in response to Palestinian rocket fire.

title: How did North Korean soldiers wander across the world most heavily guarded border ?
message:
The Demilitarized Zone between the two rival Koreas might be the most heavily armed place on earthHow did North Korean soldiers wander across the world's most heavily guarded border?
So how, on the eve of Russian President Vladimir Putin’s summit Wednesday with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, did as many as 30 North Korean soldiers wander over the line separating North from South, causing South Korea to fire warning shots before the North Koreans withdrew?
When North Korean soldiers briefly crossed a different part of the line on June 11, the same scenario played out: Warning shots from the South; a North Korean withdrawal.
The North’s accidental intrusions this month may have been caused by a sudden jump in North Korean troops fortifying their side of the border.
Two American Army officers were axed to death in 1976 by North Korean soldiers, for instance.

message:

message:

title: CENTCOM : US Airstrike In Syria Kills Senior ISIS Militant
message:
(MENAFN- Kuwait News Agency (KUNA)) WASHINGTON, June 19 (KUNA) - The US Central Command said Wednesday that its forces have killed a senior Islamic State group in an in Syria early this week.
In a press statement, the CENTCOM announced that it had conducted an airstrike in Syria on June 16, killing Usamah Jamal Muhammad Ibrahim al-Janabi, a senior official and facilitator.
"His death will disrupt ISIS's ability to resource and conduct terror attacks," reads the statement.
It vowed that it, alongside allies and partners in the region, will continue to execute operations to degrade ISIS operational capabilities and ensure its enduring defeat.
It affirmed that there is no indication any civilians were harmed in this strike.

title: Russia - Ukraine war : List of key events , day 846
message: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 846As the war enters its 846th day, these are the main developments.
event_breakdown:
Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 846

As the war enters its 846th day, these are the main developments:

1. Missile strikes on a railway station in Kramatorsk, eastern Ukraine, killed at least 50 people and injured more than 100 on April 8, according to Ukrainian officials.
2. Russian forces continued missile and rocket attacks across Ukraine, targeting residential areas, Ukrainian military installations, and infrastructure.
3. Russian shelling of civilian areas in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions killed at least seven people and injured 17 on April 8, according to the Ukrainian military.
4. Ukrainian defenders in the southern city of Mariupol appealed for help as they said Russian forces had breached their defenses and planted mines throughout the Azovstal steel plant, where hundreds of civilians and fighters had taken shelter.

Note: This is a snapshot of current events reported as of April 9, 2023.

title: Graduate , dad slashed outside of high school graduation at Hofstra University
message:
A high school graduate and a father of a student were slashed by a group of masked suspects outside Hofstra University after the teen’s commencement ceremony, according to officials and police sources.
The man was slashed on the leg and a graduating senior was slashed on the left ear when he tried to intervene outside of the university’s campus, sources and school officials confirmed.
The suspects were wearing masks at the time of the attack, school officials told The Post.
The attack happened outside of Hofstra’s sports center following a high school graduation.
We underscore that this incident took place outside of the graduation venue.,” Academy Charter High School said in a statement.

title: Israel may have violated laws of war in Gaza , UN rights office says
message:
GENEVA - Israeli forces may have repeatedly violated fundamental principles of the laws of war and failed to distinguish between civilians and fighters in their Gaza Strip military campaign, the United Nations human rights office said on June 19.
In a report assessing six Israeli attacks that caused a high number of casualties and destruction of civilian infrastructure, the UN human rights office said Israeli forces "may have systematically violated the principles of distinction, proportionality and precautions in attack".
Israel's air and ground offensive has killed more than 37,400 people in Gaza, according to the health authorities there.
Last week, the UN human rights office said the killing of civilians during an Israeli operation to free four hostages could amount to war crimes, but so might Palestinian militants' holding of captives in densely populated areas.

title: As Putin visits Vietnam , the story of how Soviet Russia helped it defeat US
message:
APFrom one Soviet Russia ally to another, Russia President Vladimir Putin landed in Vietnam on Thursday after a two-day visit to North Korea.
This is a reference to the days when Vietnam was divided into North Vietnam (under communist influence) and South Vietnam (under France backed by the US) during the 1950s to 1970s.
The US sided with South Vietnam to keep Ho Chi Minh out of power in a unified Vietnam.
In 1968, Soviet Russia signed a fresh military and economic accord with North Vietnam.
This critical help from Soviet Russia led to the eventual withdrawal of US troops and the unification of Vietnam under communist rule.
event_breakdown: Russian President Putin landed in Vietnam on Thursday after a two-day visit to North Korea. Russia and Vietnam are close allies, and Russia's vital support helped North Vietnam eventually unify the country under communist rule.

title: Moment  Houthi drone slam into enormous 750ft cargo ship sparking deadly explosion before vessel sank in latest attack in the Red Sea
message:
A 750ft cargo ship has sunk in the Red Sea days after Yemen's Houthi rebels said they launched a blistering drone attack on the vessel, reportedly killing one mariner on board.
It would be the second ship sunk as part of the rebels' campaign targeting Red Sea shipping after the Rubymar, which was carrying more than 41,000 tonnes of fertiliser, went down in March around two weeks after being struck by missiles.
In March, the Belize-flagged Rubymar carrying fertilizer cargo sank in the Red Sea after taking on water for days following a rebel attack.
A recent report by the US Defense Intelligence Agency said that container shipping through the Red Sea has declined by 90 per cent since December because of the attacks.
It also claimed destroying two Houthi drone boats in the Red Sea as well over the last 24 hours.

title: 3 IS militants killed in airstrikes in Iraq
message:
Baghdad, June 20 : Three Islamic State (IS) militants were killed on Thursday in airstrikes in the northern province of Kirkuk, the Iraqi military said.
The warplanes carried out another airstrike on the nearby caves and tunnels used by the militants, Xinhua news agency reported.
A source in the Iraqi army told Xinhua on condition of anonymity that a force from Kirkuk Operations Command was dispatched to the scene to search the attacked sites.
The security situation in Iraq has improved since the defeat of the IS in 2017.
However, IS remnants have sneaked into the urban centres, deserts, and rugged areas, carrying out frequent guerilla attacks against security forces and civilians.

title: Russia pounds Ukraine energy sites in latest  mas attack
message:
KYIV: A Russian missile and drone barrage damaged a Ukrainian power plant and other energy facilities overnight, officials said on Thursday (Jun 20), the latest in a series of strikes that have pushed its grid to the brink.
"The enemy attacked a number of energy infrastructure facilities," the energy ministry said, adding that the barrage of Russian projectiles targeted energy-linked sites in four regions, including the capital, without elaborating.
AFP journalists in the capital heard air raid sirens ringing out over the capital in the early hours of Thursday.
DTEK, Ukraine's largest private energy company, said the aerial attacks had caused "serious damage" at one of its thermal power plants, and that three of its employees had been wounded in the attack.
"This is already the seventh mass attack on the company's thermal power plant in the last three months," the company said.

title: Russia Targets Ukraine Power Grid
message:
Russia destroyed and damaged Ukrainian energy facilities overnight as President Vladimir Putin’s forces continue attacks to disrupt the country’s power system.
DTEK, the country’s largest power producer, said three workers were wounded in the barrage, which did serious damage to one of its thermal power plants.
This was the seventh attack against the company’s power plants over the past three months, DTEK said on Telegram.
Russia said the Ukrainian military also launched drone attacks overnight against its territory.
Tambov governor Maksim Yegorov said that a presumed drone attack lit a fuel reservoir in the region on fire.
event_breakdown: Russia-Ukraine Conflict: Russia targets Ukrainian power plants, wounding 3 workers and doing serious damage to thermal power plants.

title: Vladimir Putin arrives in Vietnam for his final stop on a two - nation Asia tour
message:
Vladimir Putin has arrived in Vietnam for discussions with its communist leaders as part of his tour of Asia.
Upon arrival at Hanoi airport, the Russian president was greeted by Vietnamese deputy prime minister Tran Hong Ha among other party diplomats.
Putin's visit to Vietnam follows a high-profile trip to Pyongyang, where he and Kim Jong-un signed a mutual defense agreement.
The visit has sparked criticism from the US, one of Vietnam's key trade partners, who have expressed concerns about Russia's disregard for international law.
This marks Putin's fifth visit to Vietnam as president, highlighting the longstanding partnership between Moscow and Hanoi since the Soviet era.
event_breakdown:
Vladimir Putin visits Vietnam after Pyongyang
US-Vietnam relations soured by Russia's disregard of international law

title: Critical Infrastructure Site Hit In Vinnytsia Region
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) Russian forces have attacked a critical infrastructure facility in Ukraine's central Vinnytsia region.
That's according to Suspilne Vinnytsia , which refers to the region's governor, Serhii Borzov, Ukrinform reports.
"A critical infrastructure site has been hit as a result of the Russian army's attack in the Vinnytsia region, regional governor Borzov said.
All the necessary measures are being taken at the scene to eliminate the consequences," the report said.
The enemy launched several groups of Shahed one-way strike drones at Ukraine on the night of June 19 to 20.
event_breakdown: Target event: Russia launches several groups of Shahed one-way strike drones at Ukraine.

title: Russia drone attack damages energy infrastructure in 4 oblasts , injures civilians
message:
Russian drone attacks in the early hours of June 20 damaged energy infrastructure in Vinnytsia, Kyiv, Dnipropetrovsk, and Donetsk oblasts, reported state-owned energy operator Ukrenergo.
At least three people - men aged 30, 41, and 63 - were injured overnight in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, according to regional governor Serhii Lysak.
Russia's attack on the Nikopol district of Dnipropetrovsk Oblast also damaged seven private residences, five warehouses, cars, and power lines.
Russian troops also attacked one of DTEK's, Ukraine's largest private energy company's, thermal power plants, "severely" damaging the equipment, the company said.
Russia used at least nine missiles and 27 drones to target Ukraine, according to the Air Force's morning update.
event_breakdown: Russia used at least nine missiles and 27 drones to target  Ukraine, according to the Air Force's morning update. Notable targets include energy infrastructure in Vinnytsia, Kyiv, Dnipropetrovsk, and Donetsk oblasts. In Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, at least seven private residences, five warehouses, cars, and power lines were damaged by Russian troops in the  Nikopol district. Russia also attacked one of DTEK's thermal power plants, "severely" damaging the equipment.

message:
Amid the IDF's tactical maneuvers in Gaza, the Air Force and the Air Defense Division have been locked in a complex, Sisyphean struggle for nearly nine months.
Although Iron Dome wasn't originally designed to counter drones, the Air Force has been adapting it to provide an adequate response.

title: South Korea Blasts Russia - North Korea Deal , Says It Will Consider Possible Arms Supplies to Ukraine
message:
SEOUL, South Korea — South Korea’s presidential office on Thursday condemned an agreement reached by Russia and North Korea that vowed mutual defense assistance in the event of war and said it will reconsider its policy of limiting its support to Ukraine to non-lethal supplies.
South Korea, a growing arms exporter with a well-equipped military backed by the United States, has provided humanitarian aid and other support to Ukraine while joining U.S.-led economic sanctions against Moscow.
North Korea and the former Soviet Union signed a treaty in 1961, which experts say necessitated Moscow’s military intervention if the North came under attack.
“We are currently reviewing the specifics of the treaty signed between Russia and North Korea during President Putin’s visit to North Korea.
The Koreas also have engaged in Cold War-style psychological warfare that involved North Korea dropping tons of trash on the South with balloons, and the South broadcasting anti-North Korean propaganda with its loudspeakers.
event_breakdown:
Event: Seoul, South Korea
South Korea's presidential office said on Thursday that it plans to reconsider its policy of limiting support to Ukraine to non-lethal supplies.

title: Israel resumes assassination of Hezbollah cadres as rockets fired at its north
message:
Hezbollah said it fired dozens of rockets into northern Israel Thursday in retaliation for a deadly strike in south Lebanon, a day after a fiery speech from the group's leader.
Hezbollah on Thursday said that "in response to the assassination that the Israeli enemy carried out in the village of Deir Kifa," fighters targeted an Israeli barracks in Zar’it "with dozens of Katyusha rockets."
Lebanon's official National News Agency had reported one dead after an "enemy drone" struck a vehicle in south Lebanon's Deir Kifa area.
A source close to the group, requesting anonymity, told AFP he was killed in the Deir Kifa strike.
Lebanon’s National News Agency said that airstrike targeted the Bir Kallab area in Iqlim al-Tuffah's heights, deep in south Lebanon, as artillery shelling hit Khiam, Kfarkela and al-Ezziyeh.
location: The main event takes place in south Lebanon.
event_breakdown: IDF launches attacks on Iran-backed Shi'ite militant groups based in Lebanon after a drone attack targeting Israeli army position in the Shebaa Farms was reported earlier on Wednesday.

title: Israeli army says they killed a Hezbollah commander in south Lebanon
message:
Beirut/Tel Aviv, June 20 : The Israeli army said on Thursday that they killed another pro-Iranian Hezbollah commander in southern Lebanon.
It said that "terrorist Fadel Ibrahim" was eliminated by an Israeli aircraft in a precise strike in the area of Deir Kifa in southern Lebanon.
There were also Israeli attacks on other places in southern Lebanon like Khiyam and Iqlim al-Tuffah region.
The Israeli military also said it had destroyed a rocket launcher on Lebanese soil.
There are concerns that the conflict between the Israeli military and the Hezbollah militia will continue to expand.
event_breakdown: The Israeli army killed another pro-Iranian Hezbollah commander by an aircraft on Thursday, in the area of Deir Kifa in southern Lebanon. There were attacks on other places in southern Lebanon, like Khiyam and Iqlim al-Tuffah region, and the Israeli military destroyed a rocket launcher on Lebanese soil.

message:
Lebanon's Hezbollah has new weapons and intelligence capabilities that could help it target more critical positions deeper inside Israel in case of an all-out war , the militant group's leader has warned.
Hezbollah supporters watch a speech given by Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah on a screen during a ceremony to commemorate the death of senior Hezbollah commander Taleb Sami Abdullah.
The Israeli military said two Hezbollah launches damaged several vehicles in northern Israel.
Israeli strikes have killed more than 400 people in Lebanon, most of them Hezbollah and other militants, but also more than 80 civilians and non-combatants.
In northern Israel, 16 soldiers and 11 civilians have been killed by strikes launched from Lebanon.

title: Romania to send Patriot system to Ukraine as Russia pounds its power grid
message:
NATO member Romania has announced it will send a Patriot missile system to Ukraine, which has repeatedly called on its allies to increase their air defence support as Russia attacks its energy infrastructure.
Russia fired nine missiles and launched 27 Shahed drones at energy facilities and critical infrastructure in central and eastern Ukraine, the Ukrainian air force said.
The attack hit power structures in the Donetsk, Dnipropetrovsk, Kyiv and Vinnytsia regions of Ukraine, causing “extensive damage”, according to the national power company Ukrenergo.
The overnight drone attacks were carried out by Ukraine’s Security Service, known by its acronym SBU, a Kyiv security official told The Associated Press news agency.
Russia’s Ministry of Defence said air defences downed 15 Ukrainian drones over three regions but did not mention any damage.
location: The main location where the event takes place is Ukraine

title: Attack on army base fuels Burkina Faso mutiny rumours
message:
Burkina Faso has been battling Islamist insurgents for several years and about half the country is outside government control.
A day after the Mansila attack, a rocket hit the parking area of state TV Radiotélévision Burkinabé (RTB) in the capital, Ouagadougou.
Local media outlets in Burkina Faso have downplayed the RTB incident and the Mansila attack, perhaps over fears of a crackdown.
Capt Traoré has largely kept a low profile since the Mansila attack.
The two attacks came about a week after Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov visited Burkina Faso and announced plans to send more military instructors to the country.
event_breakdown:
April 16, Mansila, Burkina Faso

Burkina Faso's minister of defense, Maj. Gen. Yien Yeouchi Yaya, survived an assassination attempt by Islamist insurgents Monday. The attack occurred at about noon about 50 kilometers to the south of Ouagadougou when three gunmen opened fire on a vehicle transporting Yaya, the country's armed forces chief, Gen. Yark Damehane, and four other soldiers. Yaya was unhurt, but several of his entourage were wounded.

The attacks occurred at a sensitive time. The day before the Mansila attack, a rocket hit the parking area of the national television building in the capital, Ouagadougou. The attack targeted a state TV Radiotélévision Burkinabé (RTB) car extensively; no injuries have been reported. Burkina Faso has been battling Islamist insurgents for several years and half the country is outside government control.

The RTB and Mansila attacks came a week after Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov visited Burkina Faso and announced plans to send more military instructors to the country. These instructors were "to help develop Burkina Faso's armed forces" against foreign-backed insurgents. Lavrov noted, on that basis, that "terrorist groups" in Burkina Faso "have gained power because of the situation in neighboring Mali."

title: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah warns Israel about the cost of a war in Lebanon
message:
BEIRUT — As fighting along the Lebanese-Israeli border escalates, Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah is warning Israel that if the conflict were to slide into war, Israeli forces would face a much more powerful enemy than in the past.
Nasrallah as well repeated that Hezbollah did not want war, but that the current fighting risked sliding into a much wider battle.
Nasrallah said that in previous wars with Israel, Hezbollah had only hoped of being able to strike Israel’s Meron air base — the center for its northern Israel operations command.
Hezbollah fought another war with Israel in 2006.
Nasrallah said Cyprus allowing its bases to be used to target Lebanon would make it “part of the war, and the resistance will deal with it as part of the war."

title: Russia obliterates Ukraine front - line towns faster with hacked bombs and expanded air base network
message:
Russia obliterates Ukraine’s front-line towns faster with hacked bombs and expanded air base networkKHARKIV, Ukraine (AP) — The first shock wave shattered aisles stacked almost to the ceiling with home improvement products.
The next Russian bomb streaked down like a comet seconds later, unleashing flames that left the megastore an ashen shell.
Investigators hope it will help them trace the supply chain for the latest generation of retrofitted Russian “glide bombs” that are laying waste to eastern Ukraine.
In all, glide bombs have hit the city more than 50 times this year, according to Spartak Borysenko of the Kharkiv regional prosecutor’s office.
Photos on Russian Telegram channels linked to the military show glide bombs being launched three and four at a time.

message:
A man was hospitalized after a fight led to a stabbing at an LA Fitness in Miami-Dade Thursday morning, authorities said.
The incident happened at the gym at 14100 Southwest 8th Street in Tamiami.
Miami-Dade Police said the incident happened around 8 a.m. after a fight led to a stabbing.
Miami-Dade Fire Rescue officials said crews responded, and police said one man was hospitalized in critical but stable condition.
Camila Vergara was at the gym to work out just after the incident happened and said she saw the stabbing victim being taken out on a stretcher.

title: Israel mounts Rafah ground invasion , batters central Gaza camps
message:
Israeli tanks have moved deeper inside southern Gaza's Rafah as airplanes pounded areas in the central parts of the strip overnight, killing at least three people and wounding dozens of others.
In Deir al-Balah, a city packed with displaced people in the central Gaza Strip, an Israeli airstrike killed one Palestinian and wounded several others Thursday, medics said.
Rafah housed over half of Gaza's 2.3 million people until May 7 when Israeli forces began the ground offensive into the city.
(AA Photo)On Thursday, Israeli authorities freed 33 Palestinians who had been detained during the past months by Israeli forces in different areas of the enclave.
The freed detainees were admitted into Al-Aqsa Hospital in Deir al-Balah in the central Gaza Strip after they complained of torture and mistreatment by Israeli jailers.

title: What would war between Israel and Hezbollah mean for the Middle East ?
message:
Though the events of October 7 and their aftermath have affected the situation, Hezbollah and Israel have been embroiled in low-level conflict since Hezbollah was formed in 1982.
In response, Israel embarked on a destructive war designed to eliminate Hezbollah.
At the time, the war was sold by Israel both domestically and internationally with a similar objective to that found in the current war against Hamas.

message:
Russia attacked a village in Ukraine's eastern Donetsk region on Thursday, killing three people and injuring four more, including a child, prosecutors said.
The village of Rozkishne, about 25 km from the front line, was targeted by the strike, regional prosecutors said on Telegram.

title: Ukraine claims its drones hit a Russian oil facility , sparking a huge blaze - New Delhi Times - India Only International Newspaper
message:
Ukraine claimed responsibility Tuesday for an overnight drone attack on a Russian oil facility that started a massive blaze in the latest long-range strike by Kyiv’s forces on a border region.
Ukraine has in recent months stepped up aerial assaults on Russian soil, targeting refineries and oil terminals in an effort to slow down the Kremlin’s war machine.
The attack set fire to an oil reservoir in Russia’s Rostov region and more than 200 firefighters were at the scene, according to Rostov Gov.
The blaze covered an area of 5,000 square meters (55,000 square feet) but there were no casualties, Russia’s Emergencies Ministry said.
The drones targeted two Rostov oil depots that have 22 oil reservoirs, the official said.
event_breakdown: Event 1: Ukraine is responsible for an overnight drone attack on a Russian oil facility that set alight a massive blaze in the Rostov region.

title: Russia strikes Ukraine power grid ; Kyiv drones hit enemy
message:
In its seventh major attack on Ukrainian power plants since Moscow intensified energy infrastructure attacks three months ago, Russia fired nine missiles and 27 Shahed drones at energy facilities and critical infrastructure in central and eastern Ukraine, the Ukrainian air force said.
The attack hit power structures in the Donetsk, Dnipropetrovsk, Kyiv and Vinnytsia regions of Ukraine, according to national power company Ukrenergo.
Private energy company DTEK said one of its power plants was hit in the overnight attack but did not specify its location.
The head of the Tambov region, Maxim Yegorov, said an oil reservoir went ablaze at an oil depot there.
Russia’s Defense Ministry said air defenses downed 15 Ukrainian drones over three regions but didn’t mention any damage.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: Russian army fired nine missiles and 27 Shahed drones at energy facilities and critical infrastructure in central and eastern Ukraine, causing the Donetsk, Dnipropetrovsk, Kyiv and Vinnytsia regions of Ukraine to be hit with power structures damaged.
Event 2: An oil reservoir in an oil depot in Tambov region of Russia caught aflame after a Russian attack.

title: Drone Strikes Ignite Fires at Russian Fuel Depots Amid Escalating Tensions
message:
Maxim Yegorov, governor of the Tambov region southeast of Moscow, said firefighters were tackling a blaze at the Platonovskaya fuel depot that broke out after an explosion probably caused by a drone.
RIA news agency said a second reservoir had caught fire at the fuel depot.
Drone strikes on large fuel depots across Russia have intensified in the last days, while attacks on oil refineries, whose operations have far greater impact on global oil markets and prices, have subsided.
Ukraine says Russian energy installations are legitimate targets because they support Moscow's war effort at a time when Russian strikes are pounding Ukrainian cities and infrastructure.
A Russian attack overnight damaged energy infrastructure in four Ukrainian regions on Thursday, the Ukrainian energy ministry said, injuring three workers and cutting power to some consumers.
event_breakdown: Drone strikes on Russian fuel depots.

title: Woman detained in Kyiv over desecration of renowned fallen soldier graves
message:
A 60-year-old woman was arrested in Kyiv on June 20 on suspicion that she had desecrated the graves of three well-known Ukrainian defenders, the Kyiv City Prosecutor's Office reported.
The graves belonged to the legendary commander Dmytro "Da Vinci" Kotsiubailo, MiG-29 pilot Andrii "Juice" Pilshchykov, and activist-turned-soldier Pavlo Petrychenko.
"Da Vinci" was killed by Russian soldiers in March 2023 near Bakhmut in Donetsk Oblast.
Petrychenko was a well-known Kyiv activist involved in the fight against corruption.

title: Cyprus stresses neutrality after Hezbollah threat over Israel war
message:
“Cyprus is not involved, and will not be involved, in any war or conflicts,” the Cypriot government spokesperson, Konstantinos Letymbiotis, told the public broadcaster CyBC.
Nasrallah had warned on Wednesday of a war “without rules or ceilings” as he sought to highlight the perils of a full-scale Israeli offensive against his Iran-aligned organisation.
Two years ago the Israel Defence Forces used Cyprus to stage war games simulating combat in Lebanon, involving what was said to be the largest ever number of troops sent abroad by Israel.
Although not known to offer any land or base facilities to the Israeli military, Cyprus has allowed Israel to use its airspace to conduct drills simulating an Iranian attack on Israel.
Some said it was likely to spur Greece, which also enjoys excellent ties with Israel, to implore its ally to give peace a chance before launching an offensive against Hezbollah.
